DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to assess the potential therapeutic benefit of catheter-based renal sympathetic denervation using therapeutic unfocussed ultrasound in a single-arm feasibility trial.
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study of Renal Denervation for the Treatment of Resistant Hypertension
DOC.criteria: Uncontrolled hypertension (defined as SBP ≥ 140 mmHg during 24Hr Ambulatory BP monitoring) Current treatment with ≥ 3 antihypertensive drugs (including at least one diuretic) Renal artery diameter ≥5mm by digital angiography Accessibility of renal vasculature Estimated GFR < 45 Type 1 Diabetes Known renovascular abnormalities (eg, renal artery stenosis, previous renal artery stenting or angioplasty)
